result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation on 06/27/22 by 02:00PM

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:46 PM CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel. Defendant Melissa Marie Schlussler in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Melissa Marie Schlussler.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Agent present, notes DE has approx. 30 days left in custody, DE needs to provide Agent with name and address of party with whom she will be staying upon release. Atty Ballo responds, notes the State holds on request to revoke in advance. Atty Dolfi responds. Agent would like DE to fulfill the full 60 day sanction. Agent does not object to Huber for work. Court approves Huber for work. Court does not modify or change condition time today. Atty Ballo requests another PRH after DE's release. Agent may appear by zoom. Atty Dolfi makes statements re: DE and her children. Adjourned: 2:57 pm.

3:26 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Marie Schlussler in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Melissa Marie Schlussler. Agent Cormican appeared by video via Zoom. Court reviews file. Agent requests Court lift stay on condition time. Atty Dolfi states DE has kept in contact with Agent. Agent Cormican states she met with DE on 7/5/22 and didn't report to the follow week for a scheduled meeting. Agent states DE hasn't completed intake and only the COMPAS was completed. ADA Ballo states DE has a pending matter before Branch 1. Atty Dolfi states DE didn't receive notifications to keep in touch with Agent. Agent states she communicated with DE by text message and recites communication verbatim. Court lifts stay on condition time effective 7/24/22.ADA Ballo requests motion to revoke DJOC be held in abeyance. Court sets further PRH. Adjourned at 3:40 PM.  gll

10:43 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY: Melissa M. Petersen, DF: Melissa Marie Schlussler appeared. Includes 22CF280, 22CF406, 22CM187, 22FO80. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to 22CF280 Count 1: Possession of Meth-961.41(3g)(g)- 2 year DJOC,  Count 2: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia -961.573(1), and Case 22CM187 Count 1: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia- 961.573(1). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismiss and read-in 22CF406. Court dismissed 22FO80. Sentencing arguments.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Assessment Report filed by JSS (sealed). sf
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.  

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
